chunk.text: Key indicators: single-crystal X-ray study; T = 123 K; mean (C-C) = 0.005 Å; R factor = 0.058; wR factor = 0.159; data-to-parameter ratio = 16.2.

The title compound, C 23 H 25 BrN 2 O 3 , crystallizes with two independent molecules in the asymmetric unit (Z 0 = 2) which differ in the twist of the 5-bromo-1H-indole ring with respect to the plane of the 4-methyl-1,4,5,6,7,8-hexahydroquinoline ring [dihedral angles of 78.55 (9) and 89.70 (8) in molecules A and B, respectively]. The indole ring is planar in both molecules [maximum deviations = 0.021 (3) and À0.020 (3) Å for the N atom] while the cyclohexene ring has adopts a sofa conformation. In the crystal, molecules are linked by pairs of N-HÁ Á ÁO hydrogen bonds, forming dimers with R 1 2 (6) ring motifs. These dimers are connected by N-HÁ Á ÁO hydrogen bonds, generating chains along [110]. A C-HÁ Á ÁO contact occurs between the independent molecules.
